019package org.apache.shiro.web.env;
020
021import org.apache.shiro.config.ConfigurationException;
022import org.apache.shiro.config.Ini;
023import org.apache.shiro.config.IniFactorySupport;
024import org.apache.shiro.io.ResourceUtils;
025import org.apache.shiro.util.*;
026import org.apache.shiro.web.config.IniFilterChainResolverFactory;
027import org.apache.shiro.web.config.ShiroFilterConfiguration;
028import org.apache.shiro.web.config.WebIniSecurityManagerFactory;
029import org.apache.shiro.web.filter.mgt.FilterChainResolver;
030import org.apache.shiro.web.mgt.WebSecurityManager;
031import org.apache.shiro.web.util.WebUtils;
032import org.slf4j.Logger;
033import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
034
035import javax.servlet.ServletContext;
036import java.io.IOException;
037import java.io.InputStream;
038import java.util.HashMap;
039import java.util.Map;

041/**
042 * {@link WebEnvironment} implementation configured by an {@link Ini} instance or {@code Ini} resource locations.
043 *
044 * @since 1.2
045 */
046public class IniWebEnvironment extends ResourceBasedWebEnvironment implements Initializable, Destroyable {
047
048    public static final String DEFAULT_WEB_INI_RESOURCE_PATH = "/WEB-INF/shiro.ini";
049    public static final String FILTER_CHAIN_RESOLVER_NAME = "filterChainResolver";
050    public static final String SHIRO_FILTER_CONFIG_NAME = "shiroFilter";
051
052    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(IniWebEnvironment.class);
053
054    /**
055     * The Ini that configures this WebEnvironment instance.
056     */
057    private Ini ini;
058
059    private WebIniSecurityManagerFactory factory;
060
061    public IniWebEnvironment() {
062        factory = new WebIniSecurityManagerFactory();
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Initializes this instance by resolving any potential (explicit or resource-configured) {@link Ini}
067     * configuration and calling {@link #configure() configure} for actual instance configuration.
068     */
069    public void init() {
070
071        setIni(parseConfig());
072
073        configure();
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Loads configuration {@link Ini} from {@link #getConfigLocations()} if set, otherwise falling back
078     * to the {@link #getDefaultConfigLocations()}. Finally any Ini objects will be merged with the value returned
079     * from {@link #getFrameworkIni()}
080     * @return Ini configuration to be used by this Environment.
081     * @since 1.4
082     */
083    protected Ini parseConfig() {
084        Ini ini = getIni();
085
086        String[] configLocations = getConfigLocations();
087
088        if (log.isWarnEnabled() && !CollectionUtils.isEmpty(ini) &&
089                configLocations != null && configLocations.length > 0) {
090            log.warn("Explicit INI instance has been provided, but configuration locations have also been " +
091                    "specified.  The {} implementation does not currently support multiple Ini config, but this may " +
092                    "be supported in the future. Only the INI instance will be used for configuration.",
093                    IniWebEnvironment.class.getName());
094        }
095
096        if (CollectionUtils.isEmpty(ini)) {
097            log.debug("Checking any specified config locations.");
098            ini = getSpecifiedIni(configLocations);
099        }
100
101        if (CollectionUtils.isEmpty(ini)) {
102            log.debug("No INI instance or config locations specified.  Trying default config locations.");
103            ini = getDefaultIni();
104        }
105
106        // Allow for integrations to provide default that will be merged other configuration.
107        // to retain backwards compatibility this must be a different method then 'getDefaultIni()'
108        ini = mergeIni(getFrameworkIni(), ini);
109
110        if (CollectionUtils.isEmpty(ini)) {
111            String msg = "Shiro INI configuration was either not found or discovered to be empty/unconfigured.";
112            throw new ConfigurationException(msg);
113        }
114        return ini;
115    }
116
117    protected void configure() {
118
119        this.objects.clear();
120
121        WebSecurityManager securityManager = createWebSecurityManager();
122        setWebSecurityManager(securityManager);
123
124        ShiroFilterConfiguration filterConfiguration = createFilterConfiguration();
125        setShiroFilterConfiguration(filterConfiguration);
126
127        FilterChainResolver resolver = createFilterChainResolver();
128        if (resolver != null) {
129            setFilterChainResolver(resolver);
130        }
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Extension point to allow subclasses to provide an {@link Ini} configuration that will be merged into the
135     * users configuration.  The users configuration will override anything set here.
136     * <p>
137     * <strong>NOTE:</strong> Framework developers should use with caution. It is possible a user could provide
138     * configuration that would conflict with the frameworks configuration.  For example: if this method returns an
139     * Ini object with the following configuration:
140     * <pre><code>
141     *     [main]
142     *     realm = com.myco.FoobarRealm
143     *     realm.foobarSpecificField = A string
144     * </code></pre>
145     * And the user provides a similar configuration:
146     * <pre><code>
147     *     [main]
148     *     realm = net.differentco.MyCustomRealm
149     * </code></pre>
150     *
151     * This would merge into:
152     * <pre><code>
153     *     [main]
154     *     realm = net.differentco.MyCustomRealm
155     *     realm.foobarSpecificField = A string
156     * </code></pre>
157     *
158     * This may cause a configuration error if <code>MyCustomRealm</code> does not contain the field <code>foobarSpecificField</code>.
159     * This can be avoided if the Framework Ini uses more unique names, such as <code>foobarRealm</code>. which would result
160     * in a merged configuration that looks like:
161     * <pre><code>
162     *     [main]
163     *     foobarRealm = com.myco.FoobarRealm
164     *     foobarRealm.foobarSpecificField = A string
165     *     realm = net.differentco.MyCustomRealm
166     * </code></pre>
167     *
168     * </p>
169     *
170     * @return Ini configuration used by the framework integrations.
171     * @since 1.4
172     */
173    protected Ini getFrameworkIni() {
174        return null;
175    }
176
177    protected Ini getSpecifiedIni(String[] configLocations) throws ConfigurationException {
178
179        Ini ini = null;
180
181        if (configLocations != null && configLocations.length > 0) {
182
183            if (configLocations.length > 1) {
184                log.warn("More than one Shiro .ini config location has been specified.  Only the first will be " +
185                        "used for configuration as the {} implementation does not currently support multiple " +
186                        "files.  This may be supported in the future however.", IniWebEnvironment.class.getName());
187            }
188
189            //required, as it is user specified:
190            ini = createIni(configLocations[0], true);
191        }
192
193        return ini;
194    }
195
196    protected Ini mergeIni(Ini ini1, Ini ini2) {
197
198        if (ini1 == null) {
199            return ini2;
200        }
201
202        if (ini2 == null) {
203            return ini1;
204        }
205
206        // at this point we have two valid ini objects, create a new one and merge the contents of 2 into 1
207        Ini iniResult = new Ini(ini1);
208        iniResult.merge(ini2);
209
210        return iniResult;
211    }
212
213    protected Ini getDefaultIni() {
214
215        Ini ini = null;
216
217        String[] configLocations = getDefaultConfigLocations();
218        if (configLocations != null) {
219            for (String location : configLocations) {
220                ini = createIni(location, false);
221                if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(ini)) {
222                    log.debug("Discovered non-empty INI configuration at location '{}'.  Using for configuration.",
223                            location);
224                    break;
225                }
226            }
227        }
228
229        return ini;
230    }
231
232    /**
233     * Creates an {@link Ini} instance reflecting the specified path, or {@code null} if the path does not exist and
234     * is not required.
235     * <p/>
236     * If the path is required and does not exist or is empty, a {@link ConfigurationException} will be thrown.
237     *
238     * @param configLocation the resource path to load into an {@code Ini} instance.
239     * @param required       if the path must exist and be converted to a non-empty {@link Ini} instance.
240     * @return an {@link Ini} instance reflecting the specified path, or {@code null} if the path does not exist and
241     *         is not required.
242     * @throws ConfigurationException if the path is required but results in a null or empty Ini instance.
243     */
244    protected Ini createIni(String configLocation, boolean required) throws ConfigurationException {
245
246        Ini ini = null;
247
248        if (configLocation != null) {
249            ini = convertPathToIni(configLocation, required);
250        }
251        if (required && CollectionUtils.isEmpty(ini)) {
252            String msg = "Required configuration location '" + configLocation + "' does not exist or did not " +
253                    "contain any INI configuration.";
254            throw new ConfigurationException(msg);
255        }
256
257        return ini;
258    }
259
260
261    protected ShiroFilterConfiguration createFilterConfiguration() {
262        return (ShiroFilterConfiguration) this.objects.get(SHIRO_FILTER_CONFIG_NAME);
263    }
264
265    protected FilterChainResolver createFilterChainResolver() {
266
267        FilterChainResolver resolver = null;
268
269        Ini ini = getIni();
270
271        if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(ini)) {
272            Factory<FilterChainResolver> factory = (Factory<FilterChainResolver>) this.objects.get(FILTER_CHAIN_RESOLVER_NAME);
273            if (factory instanceof IniFactorySupport) {
274                IniFactorySupport iniFactory = (IniFactorySupport) factory;
275                iniFactory.setIni(ini);
276                iniFactory.setDefaults(this.objects);
277            }
278            resolver = factory.getInstance();
279        }
280
281        return resolver;
282    }
283
284    protected WebSecurityManager createWebSecurityManager() {
285
286        Ini ini = getIni();
287        if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(ini)) {
288            factory.setIni(ini);
289        }
290
291        Map<String, Object> defaults = getDefaults();
292        if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(defaults)) {
293            factory.setDefaults(defaults);
294        }
295
296        WebSecurityManager wsm = (WebSecurityManager)factory.getInstance();
297
298        //SHIRO-306 - get beans after they've been created (the call was before the factory.getInstance() call,
299        //which always returned null.
300        Map<String, ?> beans = factory.getBeans();
301        if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(beans)) {
302            this.objects.putAll(beans);
303        }
304
305        return wsm;
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Returns an array with two elements, {@code /WEB-INF/shiro.ini} and {@code classpath:shiro.ini}.
310     *
311     * @return an array with two elements, {@code /WEB-INF/shiro.ini} and {@code classpath:shiro.ini}.
312     */
313    protected String[] getDefaultConfigLocations() {
314        return new String[]{
315                DEFAULT_WEB_INI_RESOURCE_PATH,
316                IniFactorySupport.DEFAULT_INI_RESOURCE_PATH
317        };
318    }
319
320    /**
321     * Converts the specified file path to an {@link Ini} instance.
322     * <p/>
323     * If the path does not have a resource prefix as defined by {@link org.apache.shiro.io.ResourceUtils#hasResourcePrefix(String)}, the
324     * path is expected to be resolvable by the {@code ServletContext} via
325     * {@link javax.servlet.ServletContext#getResourceAsStream(String)}.
326     *
327     * @param path     the path of the INI resource to load into an INI instance.
328     * @param required if the specified path must exist
329     * @return an INI instance populated based on the given INI resource path.
330     */
331    private Ini convertPathToIni(String path, boolean required) {
332
333        //TODO - this logic is ugly - it'd be ideal if we had a Resource API to polymorphically encaspulate this behavior
334
335        Ini ini = null;
336
337        if (StringUtils.hasText(path)) {
338            InputStream is = null;
339
340            //SHIRO-178: Check for servlet context resource and not only resource paths:
341            if (!ResourceUtils.hasResourcePrefix(path)) {
342                is = getServletContextResourceStream(path);
343            } else {
344                try {
345                    is = ResourceUtils.getInputStreamForPath(path);
346                } catch (IOException e) {
347                    if (required) {
348                        throw new ConfigurationException(e);
349                    } else {
350                        if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
351                            log.debug("Unable to load optional path '" + path + "'.", e);
352                        }
353                    }
354                }
355            }
356            if (is != null) {
357                ini = new Ini();
358                ini.load(is);
359            } else {
360                if (required) {
361                    throw new ConfigurationException("Unable to load resource path '" + path + "'");
362                }
363            }
364        }
365
366        return ini;
367    }
368
369    //TODO - this logic is ugly - it'd be ideal if we had a Resource API to polymorphically encaspulate this behavior
370    private InputStream getServletContextResourceStream(String path) {
371        InputStream is = null;
372
373        path = WebUtils.normalize(path);
374        ServletContext sc = getServletContext();
375        if (sc != null) {
376            is = sc.getResourceAsStream(path);
377        }
378
379        return is;
380    }
381
382    /**
383     * Returns the {@code Ini} instance reflecting this WebEnvironment's configuration.
384     *
385     * @return the {@code Ini} instance reflecting this WebEnvironment's configuration.
386     */
387    public Ini getIni() {
388        return this.ini;
389    }
390
391    /**
392     * Allows for configuration via a direct {@link Ini} instance instead of via
393     * {@link #getConfigLocations() config locations}.
394     * <p/>
395     * If the specified instance is null or empty, the fallback/default resource-based configuration will be used.
396     *
397     * @param ini the ini instance to use for creation.
398     */
399    public void setIni(Ini ini) {
400        this.ini = ini;
401    }
402
403    protected Map<String, Object> getDefaults() {
404        Map<String, Object> defaults = new HashMap<String, Object>();
405        defaults.put(FILTER_CHAIN_RESOLVER_NAME, new IniFilterChainResolverFactory());
406        defaults.put(SHIRO_FILTER_CONFIG_NAME, new ShiroFilterConfiguration());
407        return defaults;
408    }
409
410    /**
411     * Returns the SecurityManager factory used by this WebEnvironment.
412     *
413     * @return the SecurityManager factory used by this WebEnvironment.
414     * @since 1.4
415     */
416    @SuppressWarnings("unused")
417    protected WebIniSecurityManagerFactory getSecurityManagerFactory() {
418        return factory;
419    }
420
421    /**
422     * Allows for setting the SecurityManager factory which will be used to create the SecurityManager.
423     *
424     * @param factory the SecurityManager factory to used.
425     * @since 1.4
426     */
427    protected void setSecurityManagerFactory(WebIniSecurityManagerFactory factory) {
428        this.factory = factory;
429    }
